problem_text:
Suppose that a finite group G has the form G = AB, where A and B are nilpotent subgroups of classes α and β respectively; then G is soluble (O. H. Kegel, H. Wielandt, 1961). Although the derived length dl(G) of G need not be bounded by α + β (see Archive, 5.17), can one bound dl(G) by a (linear) function of α and β?
L. S. Kazarin
